title: US states file lawsuit accusing Meta of harming children's mental health
description: Dozens of US states are suing the social media company for harming young people and contributing to the youth mental health crisis by knowingly and deliberately designing features on Instagram and Facebook that addict children to its platforms.

title: Champions League: Lens salvages draw as Man United clinches last-minute win
description: Bayern Munich cruised to a 3-1 victory in Istanbul on Tuesday while Jude Bellingham led Real Madrid to a 2-1 victory over Braga in Portugal and Arsenal bounced back to beat Sevilla.

title: Victor Wembanyama will shine a spotlight on fellow French NBA players
description: After years without a major sensation, French basketball is about to regain the attention of the American public thanks to the emergence of 'Wemby.' Here are the French players to watch this season on the other side of the Atlantic.

title: Trump's former lawyer, Michael Cohen, takes the stand against him at his New York civil fraud trial
description: Michael Cohen, formerly Donald Trump's loyal associate turned adversary, revealed in a courtroom face-off that he would 'arbitrarily' inflate the alleged worth of the ex-president's assets to 'whatever number Trump told us to.'

title: Algeria refuses to grant a visa to Nobel Prize-winning writer Annie Ernaux
description: No explanation was given by the authorities in Algiers. According to observers, the decision may be linked to an article co-signed in May by Ernaux, calling for the release of Algerian journalist Ihsane El Kadi.

title: EU legislators vote to slash the use of pesticides
description: Despite opposition from some conservative groups, the EU's environment committee voted to set binding targets on reducing pesticide use that target a 50% reduction by 2030.

title: Billionaires rage against anti-Israel students at Harvard
description: In a joint statement, a number of student organizations at the prestigious American university took sides against the Israeli government in its conflict with Hamas, provoking reactions from outraged donors.

title: Republicans pick Tom Emmer as nominee for House speaker as they try for a third time
description: Republican lawmakers hope the GOP whip and senior-most candidate will fill the top leadership position and get Congress back to work.

title: Hamas attack on Israel: What US intelligence services told their European counterparts
description: According to US intelligence, Hamas was surprised by the slowness of the Israeli security forces's response to the offensive by its armed commandos.

title: China announces removal of defense minister who had been out of public view for months
description: General Li Shangfu had been missing with little explanation and is the second senior Chinese official to disappear this year.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Macron calls for international coalition against Hamas
description: The French president suggested that the coalition fighting the Islamic State organization 'should also fight against Hamas' after talks with Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: Macron in Israel: A belated visit and the challenge of a diplomatic rebalancing
description: The French president traveled to Tel Aviv to express France's 'solidarity' with Israel in its war against Hamas. He is also expected to call for a 'humanitarian pause' and a 'political perspective.'

title: Platforms and record labels lobby to block French music streaming tax
description: Spotify, Deezer, Apple Music, YouTube and the record companies are trying to block a tax suggested by President Emmanuel Macron, intended to finance the National Center for Music.

title: Israel-Hamas war: 'Around 50' French citizens stuck in Gaza
description: Since Hamas's attack on October 7, no one has been allowed to leave the besieged enclave, with the exception of four hostages released by the terrorist movement.

title: At the Versailles bomb threat trial: 'Louis XIV's throne is going to blow'
description: A man was given a suspended eight-month prison sentence on Monday, following a phone call that led to the evacuation of the château on October 19. The culprit suffers from schizophrenia.

title: Brussels attack: Two suspects charged in French terror investigation
description: A Paris judge charged the men with terrorism-related charges, as the anti-terror prosecutor's office 'is continuing to determine their links' with the radicalized October 16 Brussels attacker.

title: Mexico: Three separate armed attacks leave 24 dead
description: In an 'extraordinary' outbreak of pre-electoral violence, the attacks in western and central Mexico targeted a security patrol, the brother of a mayor, and rival drug dealers.

title: Von der Leyen fuels EU discontent after closely-watched Israel visit
description: The head of the European Commission has infuriated some EU member states on her visit to Israel in the wake of the Hamas attack, where she expressed a more pro-Israeli stance than that agreed on by the 27 member states.

title: The daily life of two young Gazans, under bombs: 'So many close friends have been killed. I wonder when my turn will come'
description: For the past two weeks, Hamza Salha and Enas Mohammed have been living day by day, waiting and mourning, in the war-torn Palestinian enclave.

title: Cancer in Africa: Progress despite limited resources
description: The WHO predicts that by 2030, cancer-related mortality will exceed that of malaria, tuberculosis and HIV combined.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Vandalism of historic synagogue in Tunisia shocks Jewish community
description: On the night of October 17-18, following the news of the explosion at Gaza's Al-Ahli hospital, a Jewish place of worship was attacked by pro-Palestinians at Al-Hammah, in southern Tunisia.
